author: D.Peter Boucher, Kt. SMOM, International Master Mariner
content:
As a retired Master one appreciates Peter Bradford’s remark the “other ship” Master is usually forgotten about. The video also shows the importance of investigations and not rushing to conclusions by reading one’s crystal ball !

Good Watch

author: Casey Fasciano
content: Right after first danger signal the helmsman is giving her right rudder. The camera shows her responding about 20 degrees before they put the helm down all the way to complete the kamikaze turn across the freighters bow. Looks like they were making about 5-6 kts with plenty steerageway. From here it looks totally avoidable but the schooner capt was obsessed with trying to meet port to port. I think they hired the wrong guy to run that vessel.

author: Peter Bradford
content: Common sense should tell you that ship is not going to jump out of the way! That did not happen fast, they should have been on high alert long before contact. I feel bad for ship captain, he did not need that !

author: Andy Hall
content: Confusion over helm command v. rudder command?
